problem: High IO wait after nightly backup
symptoms: Server slow, wa% 60–80, MySQL slow queries
analysis: Backup left LVM snapshot open causing IO starvation.
solution: Remove stale snapshot and restart backup agent.

problem: CPU spike caused by runaway logrotate process
analysis: Corrupted log file causing logrotate infinite loop.
solution: Remove corrupted log and restart rsyslog.

analysis: Large transaction batches blocking the slave thread.
solution: Enable row-based replication and split batches.
steps: Optimize update scripts to smaller batches;

symptoms: Snapshot creation failed: unable to quiesce file system
root_cause: Old VMware Tools could not quiesce FS.
solution: Update VMware Tools and retry snapshot.

problem: Random service outages caused by DNS timeout
solution: Increase MTU or adjust firewall rules.
steps: Reduce DNS payload size in resolv.conf

symptoms: Permission denied even with correct filesystem permissions

root_cause: ConfigMap changed but pod not restarted.

symptoms: java killed, dmesg contains 'Out of memory'
analysis: Heap size too large for cgroup memory limit.
solution: Reduce Xmx or increase cgroup limit.

analysis: NFS server restarted while clients active.

symptoms: The trust relationship between workstation and domain failed

root_cause: High CPU load from gzip compression.
Switch port configured as static LAG.

symptoms: denied: requested access to the resource is denied

problem: Filesystem full because of deleted file still in use
symptoms: df shows full, du shows free space
root_cause: Log rotate failed to restart service.

steps: ALTER TABLE users ADD INDEX idx_email(email);
PostUp = ip link set mtu 1280 dev wg0

symptoms: Ingress controller logs upstream timed out
FATAL: remaining connection slots are reserved
Host cannot communicate over vMotion network

analysis: inode table corruption due to unclean shutdown.
solution: Run fsck and replace failing disk.

analysis: kube-proxy crashed due to iptables lock.
solution: Restart kube-proxy and disable conflicting daemon.

analysis: Dumping large InnoDB tables with many blobs.

symptoms: Event log shows licensing grace period expired

problem: pvecm status shows inconsistent ring state
solution: Disable IGMP snooping for Proxmox VLAN.
Expand scope or reduce lease time.

analysis: Network mounts attempted before network online.

problem: SMB share slow on large files

analysis: Manual failover caused diverged GTID set.

problem: Locked account after too many failed logins

analysis: Agent forwarding sending too many keys.

problem: curl fails with certificate pinning error

analysis: Subscriber cannot apply changes fast enough.

problem: TLS certificate expired on API server

analysis: App caching too many large objects.
solution: Set proper eviction policy and reduce object size.

analysis: Node left cluster due to heap pressure.

problem: High load but low CPU usage

analysis: Rsync using SSH with weak cipher.

problem: Logs not forwarded to syslog server

symptoms: 0% swap used even under memory pressure

problem: NFS performance slow for metadata ops
Application crashes due to locale error
Veeam backup failing on guest processing

solution: Fix consumer logic and restart worker.

analysis: High partition count on single broker.

root_cause: Commit failed due to rebalance events.

problem: LUKS volume fails to unlock at boot

solution: Migrate mgmt vmk to healthy NIC.
steps: esxcli network vswitch standard portgroup policy set

analysis: Repository contains too many small files.

symptoms: PAM unable to contact LDAP server

problem: OpenVPN clients cannot resolve internal DNS
symptoms: DNS queries leak to public DNS
High interrupt count on single CPU
Slabtop shows dentry and inode cache huge
root_cause: Heavy file operations without proper cache pressure.

solution: Add keyword fields and avoid leading wildcards.

symptoms: x509: certificate signed by unknown authority
solution: Add CA to host trust store.

problem: User cannot write despite free space

solution: Disable resolved or change dnsmasq port.

symptoms: Internal clients cannot reach public IP

steps: Adjust Package Point and Print Restrictions

problem: PXE fails with DHCP offer but no TFTP
Git clone fails with large repos
High system CPU due to kswapd
Service fails due to missing capabilities

symptoms: Pods failing due to CVE patches missing

problem: DFS namespace path slow to open
Pod cannot start due to policy
Cluster stuck in red after upgrade
RDS host cannot contact licensing server

solution: Recreate FS with larger inode tables.
Add PTR record or disable reverse lookup

problem: CUPS fails to start after update

steps: gpedit → Administrative Templates → Printers → Point and Print Restrictions

problem: Shared printer not visible on network

steps: Control Panel → Optional features → Add XPS Viewer

root_cause: new switch firmware applied wrong ACL
steps: permit tcp any host PRINTER eq 9100

analysis: printer uses IPv6, OS prefers IPv4
steps: disable IPv6 on printer or OS interface

problem: Samba shared printer not accepting jobs

solution: Allow SNMP or disable SNMP discovery

steps: Device Settings → Job Storage Mode → Off

analysis: Switch ports not in the same LACP group

problem: Linux bonding flaps every few minutes

steps: NIC Teaming → Teaming Mode → Switch Independent

solution: Use Hybrid NAT or add rule

analysis: administrative distance lower on other route

problem: traffic not going through IPsec tunnel

root_cause: multiple login attempts from mapped drive
solution: unlock account and update saved credentials

problem: VPN client connects but no internet

steps: Local Security Policy → Network Security → LAN Manager authentication

problem: Website blocked due to invalid certificate

solution: install KB updates or disable RPC encryption

problem: Failed to bring up VLAN interface

root_cause: rule added to filter instead of nat

analysis: no active access ports in VLAN

problem: Finder cannot connect to SMB share
curl fails with certificate verify error

root_cause: ISP router not in bridge mode

problem: IPSec tunnel up but no traffic
root_cause: no static route to remote LAN
steps: ip route add remote-net via tunnel-gw

problem: Mac cannot connect to SMB share

root_cause: DHCP from server on access port

steps: System Properties → Computer Name → Change → More
